DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Hospital Repeat Admission Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records a readmission to the same hospital within 30 days of discharge following hospitalization for surgical resection of the primary site for the same illness.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course Hospital Repeat Admission
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Readmission to the same hospital within 30 days of discharge following hospitalization for surgical resection of the primary site for the same illness.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:Make or do or perform again.:The condition of being allowed to enter.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.
Make or do or perform again.
The condition of being allowed to enter; the activity of admitting someone to something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured._Make or do or perform again._The condition of being allowed to enter._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It is unknown whether surgery of the primary site was recommended or performed. It is unknown whether the patient was readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of discharge. Death certificate only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It is unknown whether surgery of the primary site was recommended or performed. It is unknown whether the patient was readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of discharge. Death certificate only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
It is unknown whether surgery of the primary site was recommended or performed. It is unknown
whether the patient was readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of discharge. Death certificate only.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient was surgically treated and, within 30 days of being discharged, had both a planned and an unplanned readmission to the same hospital.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient was surgically treated and, within 30 days of being discharged, had both a planned and an unplanned readmission to the same hospital.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Patient was surgically treated and, within 30 days of being discharged, had both a planned and an
unplanned readmission to the same hospital.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient was surgically treated and was then readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of being discharged. This readmission was planned.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient was surgically treated and was then readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of being discharged. This readmission was planned.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Patient was surgically treated and was then readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of being discharged. This readmission was planned (chemotherapy port insertion, revision of colostomy, etc.).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient was surgically treated and was then readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of being discharged. This readmission was unplanned.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient was surgically treated and was then readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of being discharged. This readmission was unplanned.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Patient was surgically treated and was then readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of being discharged. This readmission was unplanned.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No surgical procedure of the primary site was performed. Patient not readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of discharge.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No surgical procedure of the primary site was performed. Patient not readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of discharge.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No surgical procedure of the primary site was performed. Patient not readmitted to the same hospital within 30 days of discharge.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:Make or do or perform again.:The condition of being allowed to enter.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.
Make or do or perform again.
The condition of being allowed to enter; the activity of admitting someone to something.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
